About The Job

The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

As YouTube’s media formats and products continue to evolve and new surfaces and experiences are introduced, new questions around what and how to create for the platform will emerge. Some of these questions can be answered with analyses based research, while others require deeper exploration due to product limitations or data requirements. As a result, Customer and Product Experimentation allows GPS to be the tip of the spear, providing first-to-market creative guidance around key questions for customers and sales teams at scale.

As the Global Product Solutions Experimentation Lead, you will be running the operations of a global creative experimentation program, which requires you to lead cross-functional and external conversations with key stakeholders and partners, all the while building towards creative learnings that will be scaled globally to help advertisers make the most of YouTube.

Global Solutions is the link between Google products and business. Your focus is to help turn innovation into complete, packaged tools that allow our customers to get the most that they need from our products. As part of the Global Solutions team, you'll help to ensure that Google has adopted the right strategy for our products. Working in one of three specialized areas – Performance, Brand, or Publisher & Platform – you'll use your expertise to help front-line Sales partners to work their magic quickly and effectively. You are passionate about all things digital, and want to help shape the world of online advertising.

Title: Senior Policy Lead, Chrome Web Store, Google Play
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Washington D.C., DC, USA; Atlanta, GA, USA.Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.5 years of experience in a policy, legal, Trust and Safety, or technology environment.

Preferred qualifications:

JD, MBA, or Master’s degree.1 year of experience with data privacy or security systems. Experience with the development, implementation, and maintenance of policy.

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Google Play, Android, and Chrome Web Store (CWS) Policy team is an essential component of Google's Trust and Safety organization, with responsibility for developing and launching new policies and serving as policy experts on cross-functional teams. As a Policy Specialist for Google Play, Android, and CWS Policies, you will lead and drive high-impact, global, cross-functional Security and Privacy initiatives, including the development and launch of new behavioral policies, supporting training and escalations post-policy launch, and accumulating expertise in mobile app data privacy and security domains. Additionally, you will serve as the Google Play and Android Security and Privacy policy expert for cross-functional teams such as Product, Operations, Engineering, Developer Relations, Business Development, Public Relations, and Legal to achieve consensus on critical, cross-functional policy issues.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Drive research and collaboration to set industry standards and advance education around the first principles that define our approach to trust risk areas.Support Google Play and Android policy strategy execution, identify policy gaps, and resolve high-profile policy issues coming from the public, regulators, users, and internal stakeholders.Engage internally with stakeholders across Google Play and Android and externally with key influencers and SMEs to identify and analyze emerging security and privacy threats, abuse trends, policy gaps, and opportunities, and make recommendations on how to address them.Partner with Operations to evaluate and improve enforcement processes and guidelines and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure policy analysis and recommendations consider all teams’ perspectives.Occasionally review or be exposed to sensitive or graphic content as part of core role.

The National Bankers Association Foundation supports and strengthens America's minority depository institutions (MDIs), which include Black, Hispanic, Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, and women-owned and operated banks. We provide advocacy, partnerships, and collaboration opportunities on behalf of our member banks so that together they are stronger and have a greater voice in national conversations about financial justice. Because when MDIs thrive, communities thrive.

As the National Banker Association Foundation’s Applied Research and Impact Program Manager, you will leverage your data skills and people skills to help us conduct research, manage projects, coordinate internal and external teams, and regularly represent the organization in meetings with MDI banks, Foundation partners, and other key stakeholders. You will join a small team of professionals working to support mission-driven banks including MDIs and CDFIs through key initiatives such as impact assessment, financial wellness, and digitalization.

Responsibilities

Research Work:

· Develop research objectives, projects, and proposals in concert with the Research & Impact Director in

accordance with the Foundation’s strategy, policies, procedures, and funder requirements.

· Conduct individual or collaborative research including data collection, cleaning, and analysis; help assess,

interpret, and evaluate outcomes related to the racial wealth gap, minority depository institutions, and financial

inclusion.

· Insight Generation: Translate research findings into actionable insights and strategic recommendations that

inform decision-making at both the organizational and member levels.

· Initiative Development: Proactively identify areas for new initiatives and programs based on research findings

and industry trends, with a focus on addressing the evolving needs of our members.

· Develop new concepts and ideas to extend intellectual understanding of racial wealth gap including through

novel methodologies, under the direction of the Research Director.

· Serve as a principal writer or contributor for research publications including blogs, briefs, and whitepapers, and

be able to present research findings to internal and external audiences via virtual and in-person convenings.

· Assist the R&I team in day-to-day management of special research projects and initiatives that may exist due to

strategic partnerships, sponsorships, grants, etc.

· Respond to internal data requests from within the organization that can include updating stats in messaging

guides, providing talking points to leadership for event preparation, conducting basic data analyses to answer

data queries, etc..

Impact Work:

· Provide project management support for the Foundation’s impact and compliance tool EquityEQ;

Coordinate onboarding for new subscribers, including helping to outline the data process, answer questions

about the tool itself, the impact metrics used, and broader goals and purposes around data reporting.

Serve as point of contact for individual MDIs/CDFIs and with institutional investors who are using EquityEQ.

Also serve as a point of contact with our external partners.

Engage regularly with all key stakeholders including through routine meetings, purposeful interactions at

Foundation events, and virtual convenings.

As part of your engagement with the process, help to outlining evolving knowledge of MDI impact and data

opportunities and challenges, and suggest ways of improving the tool in light of that evolving knowledge.

· Promote EquityEQ including finding new leads, co-leading tool demonstrations, and managing promotional

campaigns for the tool. Utilize research and insights to market EquityEQ and value of adoption.

· Collaborate with other Foundation teams on overlapping projects and initiatives.

Administrative Work:

· Support colleagues in developing concept notes, statements of work, grant proposals and funder updates, etc..

· Assist as needed in preparing materials for external presentations and internal meetings.

· Provide additional project management around key Foundation research and impact initiatives, with tasks

including scheduling, record-keeping, and note-taking.

· Provide administrative and operational support for virtual and in-person events to include planning, event

coordination, and follow-up activities.

· Perform other administrative duties as assigned by the Research & Impact Director.

Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree or higher

Preferred: graduate degree in the social sciences.

· 5+ years experience, including a demonstrated history of success in project management and at least 3+ years

in research roles, preferably with experience in producing both academic research and private sector or trade

association research.

· Competency in one or more statistical software such as R, Stata, or Tableau, including demonstrated ability to

source, clean, analyze, and visualize data. Experience with common public datasets, especially American

Community Survey.

Preferred: Experience with HMDA data; ability to create interactive data visualizations. Experience with GIS or

other spatial mapping. Dedication to the Foundation’s broader mission of closing the racial wealth gap,

increasing climate finance, and strengthening small businesses.

Preferred: direct experience in the financial sector and especially with mission-driven finance and climate

finance; familiarity with bank call reports, CDFI transaction level reports, and similar data sources.

· Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities with a demonstrated record of converting research insights into

actionable strategies.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams

and stakeholders and ability to convey complex information in clear and concise manner.

· Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong relationships with external partners and stakeholders.

· Experience leading teams and directly supervising diverse talents.

· Proactive and self-motivated with ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced

environment.

Title: Senior Director Human Factors and Risk Engineering
Description:
As the Bio-Rad's Senior Director of Global Human Factors and Risk Engineering, you will be responsible for establishing and managing Human Factors (HF) engineering processes. You will potentially standardize risk management (RM) practices across Bio-Rad, including RM for AI devices. Lead Quality and Regulatory (QARA) training. You will collaborate within QA/RA to refine HF processes for all new product development. Provide leadership with expertise in HF, UX design principles, and usability testing. Work with cross-functional teams to enhance Bio-Rad's HF Engineering process and evaluate RM procedures. Build a cohesive HF/RM presence, conduct user research, and oversee validation tests. Guide integration of HF into engineering functions and collaborate with various teams to prioritize safety and user experience. Develop strategies for QARA training in alignment with the QARA PMO.

How You Will Make An Impact

You will develop and implement HF/RM strategies to support business objectives and sustainable product safety and performance. Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure their success in achieving financial results. Build executive support of global quality initiatives that ensure compliance with regulatory and customer requirements. Analyze the human factors process and procedures and develop/implement pragmatic solution delivering sustainable improvement. Analyze complaints data and deliver pragmatic sustaining engineering/design improvements. Ensure the company’s usability engineering processes and methodologies meet and surpass the latest expectations of regulatory agencies;Create a list of deliverables for each stage of a product development lifecycle, that aligns with all business units and further evolve the design control processes.

What You Bring

You have a Master’s degree in a relevant discipline such as Human Factors Engineering / Ergonomics, Usability Engineering, Cognitive/Experimental/Behavioral Psychology, Industrial Design, Engineering Psychology, Risk ManagementMinimum of 15 years of professional UX/HFE experience in developing regulated and non-regulated software and/or hardware and in performing verification & validation activities. Minimum of 7 years’ experience as a functional manager in a User Experience & Human Factors organization.Experience in healthcare and FDA requirements in software design and development. Experience with pre-submissions, PMA & 510k submissions to the FDA. Experience in healthcare and FDA requirements in software design and development.Experience working in a matrixed environment and leadership of remote teams.

 Building and leading a successful team by mentoring, coaching, and elevating others  Guiding team members in strategy, research, design, alignment, analysis, process improvement, and change management  Navigating conflict resolution within your team as well as within projects, teams and partner relationships

Title: Sr. UX Researcher
Description:
Requirements

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field. Proven experience in leading and conducting both quantitative and qualitative UX research studies. Strong mentoring and leadership skills, with a track record of developing and guiding junior team members. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex research findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience working in an agile development environment is a plus. Familiarity with industry-standard UX tools and software. 

What You’ll Be Working On

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced Principal UX Researcher to lead and elevate our user experience research efforts. As a key member of our design team, you will play a crucial role in shaping the direction of our products by providing valuable insights and strategic guidance. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, with a focus on mentorship, leadership, and fostering a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities:

Provide extensive guidance and mentorship to junior UX researchers and designers, fostering their professional development and growth. Act as a thought leader within the UX research team, sharing best practices, methodologies, and insights to enhance overall team capabilities. Lead and conduct quantitative research studies, utilizing various methods such as surveys, A/B testing, and analytics to gather data-driven insights. Work closely with cross-functional teams to establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and measure the success of design changes through quantitative metrics. Synthesize and analyze user feedback and behavioral data to extract meaningful insights, identifying patterns and trends that inform design decisions. Collaborate with product managers and designers to translate research findings into actionable recommendations for product enhancements. Present research findings and insights to leadership, translating complex data into compelling narratives that guide strategic decision-making. Collaborate with leadership to shape the overall UX research strategy and align it with business objectives. Bring qualitative research experience to the team, conducting in-depth interviews, usability studies, and ethnographic research to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors. Provide guidance to junior designers by offering insights from user research and helping them integrate user-centric principles into their design processes. Foster a collaborative environment where the research and design teams work seamlessly to create user-centered solutions. 

If you are passionate about guiding teams, driving user-centric design, and contributing to the success of innovative products, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of user experience!
